Chapter 3 Data transformation 3.1 Read data 3.2 Cleaning 3.3 Data use for next few parts

Chapter 3 Data transformation library(readxl) library(tidyverse) library(stringr) 3.1 Read data Our data is come from Open Door, which is sponsored by the U.S. Government and Institute of International Education. The original data file format is Microsoft Excel, and NA is represent by “-”. More, the first column name of place code is empty, so we name it by Code of Origin. projdata <- read_excel("Census_All-Places-of-Origin_OD21.xlsx", col_types = c("numeric", "text", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric"), na = "-", col_names = T) names(projdata)[1] <- "Code of Origin" projdata <- projdata %>% select(`Place of Origin`,`Code of Origin`, `1949/50`:`2020/21`) Table 3.1: A table of the first 4 rows of our final project data. Place of Origin Code of Origin 1949/50 1954/55 1959/60 1964/65 1969/70 1974/75 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA AFRICA, SUB-SAHARAN 1000 537 862 1346 5259 6064 16040 Africa, Sub-saharan, Unspecified NA 19 NA NA 9 17 30 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA In this table, we can see the data have meaningless NA row, and the value in Place of Origin not unified into one logistic type, for example, all value in side are countries or regions. Thus, we need to cleaning them before analysis. 3.2 Cleaning 3.2.1 Remove the empty row and extra notes in data uselessRow <- rowSums(is.na(projdata)) == ncol(projdata) numNARow <- sum(uselessRow) numNARow ## [1] 30 projdata <- projdata[!uselessRow,] %>% filter(!grepl(":",`Place of Origin`)) sum(rowSums(is.na(projdata)) == ncol(projdata)) ## [1] 0 Table 3.2: A table of the last 3 rows to check no extra information. Place of Origin Code of Origin 1949/50 1954/55 1959/60 1964/65 1969/70 1974/75 Pacific Islands, Unspecified NA NA 15 38 145 327 1263 Stateless 9901 195 42 93 205 341 134 WORLD TOTAL NA 26433 34232 48486 82045 134959 154580 In this table, we can see we remove the empty rows and notes in the end, and all of the value in columns are data we need. Then we can clean the value. 3.2.2 Unified logic type of value and group In this part, we first remove the grouped summary, then deal with the former country and grouped unspecified. We assign them, based their code, on eight Continents, which are: Africa, Asia, Europe, Latin America & Caribbean, Middle East, North America, Oceania and Unknown State. We also grouped the Unspecified countries/regions to unspecified eight continents to facilitate future analysis. And since the Code of Origin give two of the Unspecified code, so we follow the rule and fill it by four digit number end with “999”. Table 3.3: A table of Unspecified data. Place of Origin Code of Origin 1949/50 1954/55 Africa, Unspecified 1999 19 3 Asia, Unspecified 2999 NA NA Europe, Unspecified 3999 NA NA Latin America & Caribbean, Unspecified 4999 173 60 Middle East, Unspecified 5999 NA NA Oceania, Unspecified 7999 NA 15 For the detail of code, please go to: 03-cleaning.Rmd 3.3 Data use for next few parts Now, this is the last step. We combine the unspecified Continents data to grouped data, and get the final data set we will use for analysis. df <- projdata.re.state %>% filter(!grepl("Unspecified",`Place of Origin`) ) %>% rows_update(temp.data.fna, by = "Place of Origin") %>% rbind(., temp.data.unsp) Table 3.4: A table of the first 6 rows of data ready for use in the future analysis. Place of Origin Code of Origin 1949/50 1954/55 1959/60 1964/65 1969/70 1974/75 Burundi 1101 NA NA NA 6 6 5 Djibouti 1102 NA NA NA NA NA 1 Eritrea 1103 NA NA NA NA NA NA Ethiopia 1104 37 62 170 266 540 2050 Kenya 1105 NA 19 156 774 492 870 Rwanda 1106 NA NA NA 2 1 4 Now this table will have this: Place of Origin: Including Places on country or region level, Unspecified is based on Continents level; Code of Origin: Code of Place, some place and former country have missing value; Academic Years: 1949/50 to 2020/21, but the years before the 21st century were inconsistent; Continents: Added group, based this eight categories: Africa, Asia, Europe, Latin America & Caribbean, Middle East, North America, Oceania and Unknown State. In next chapter, we will discuss the missing values of our data.
